solution_line_template: She wants {num_candies} candies, so she is going to pay {num_candies} candies * ${cost_per_candy}/candy = $<<{num_candies}*{cost_per_candy}={cost_candies}>>{cost_candies} for them.

She wants also {num_jellybeans} jellybeans, and they're going to cost {num_jellybeans} jellybeans * ${cost_per_jellybean}/jellybean = $<<{num_jellybeans}*{cost_per_jellybean}={cost_jellybeans}>>{cost_jellybeans}.
So after the purchase, she will be left with ${total_money} - ${cost_jellybeans} - ${cost_candies} = $<<{total_money}-{cost_jellybeans}-{cost_candies}={money_left}>>{money_left}.
